hints.content:
We know the $\greenD{\text{total}}$:

There are $\greenD{48}$ people.


And we know the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$:

There are $\blueD8$ tables.

The quotient will tell us the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$.

In this problem, the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$ is the $\purpleC{\text{number people at each table}}$.
The quotient tells us the $\purpleC{\text{number of people at each table}}$.

question.content:
There are $48$ people in the cafeteria divided evenly between $8$ tables.

**What does the expression $48\div8$ represent?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 2]]

choices.content: Number of people at each table
